text.text_translated:
"The Life of Pi" is a book. It tells a very unusual story about a boy from India named Pi. His big boat sinks in the Pacific Ocean. He is trapped on a small boat with a very dangerous tiger.

A Canadian writer named Yann Martel wrote the book. It was his third book and it came out in 2001. The book sold more than seven million copies all over the world. It also won many prizes, and people translated it into 41 languages.

Martel's father was a diplomat. A diplomat is a person who works for their country in other countries. Because of this job, Martel lived in many places as a child. He lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France and Mexico.

best_attempt.text_translated:
"The Life of Pi" is a book. It tells an amazing story about a boy from India named Pi. After his big boat sinks in the Pacific Ocean, he is trapped on a small boat with a dangerous tiger.

A Canadian writer named Yann Martel wrote the book. It was his third book and it came out in 2001. The book sold more than seven million copies all over the world. It also won many prizes, and people translated it into 41 languages.

Martel's father had an important job for his country. So, when Martel was a child, he lived in many places, like Costa Rica, Canada, France and Mexico.
